data.text:
This list will for a very long time be “work in progress”. Updates will appear every now and then. The information found here in terms of birth dates, height and weight, Football League registration etc are not taken from any newspapers, but has been collected from fellow historians and statisticians. I would VERY MUCH APPRECIATE a link or credit if this information is used on your own website, or in any print you wish to publish.

A big thank you to James Cotton and Jim Donnelly for sharing their Liverpool F.C. treasures with me. It makes me so proud that such kind people are attached to this website!

A big “thank you” also goes to: Jonny Stokkeland, Eric Doig, George Rowlands, Arnie and Gudmundur at http://www.lfchistory.com, Jeff Gaydish, the Football League archives at Deepdale (Preston), and family and relatives of the players that have contacted me. More names to be added.

If you have information that is not showing in the profiles you are very welcome to contribute and I will give you credit for the input.

xx

Omarsdottir, Katrin

Born: June 27 – 1987. Katrin Omarsdottir is an Icelandic international joined who Liverpool at the start of the 2014 season and to say she is something of a lucky charm would be an understatement. A powerful and influential presence in the middle of the park, she has played a major role in helping Matt Beard’s side win back-to-back Women’s Super League titles. Before arriving on Merseyside Katrin had spent a season in the USA sandwiched between two spells in Sweden. During her spell in the USA she was studying at the University of California, and playing for Orange County Waves. She has over 45 international caps for Iceland and played in the 2009 European Championships.

Oshoala, Asisat

Born: April 9 – 1994. Matt Beard swooped to sign recently crowned African Women’s Player of the Year, Asisat Oshoala in January 2015. Matt Beard secured the signature of the highly rated 20-year-old Nigerian international from Nigerian Women’s Championship title winners, Rivers Angels. Asisat is an explosive forward who was voted the most valuable player at the U20 World Cup in Canada in 2014, where she was the top goalscorer as the Falconets finished runners up to Germany. Asisat inspired Rivers Angels to their first league title victory since 2010 when they beat Pelican Stars to the title as well as helping her side to clinch the Nigerian Women’s Cup. Beard said: “I’m absolutely thrilled to have signed Asisat as she is one of the world’s top young footballers. Asisat proved in the U20 World Cup what a top-class talent she is and this signing is a big coup for us.”

Rolser, Nicole

Born: February 7 – 1992. Wing wizard Nicole Rolser will be hoping for an injury free 2015 after spending the majority of the 2014 campaign on the sidelines with a serious ACL injury. Rolser did return to help the club secure a second successive Women’s Super League title. King of the assists, she provides numerous chances for goal machine Natasha Dowie. Before joining the Reds at the start of the 2014 season alongside German compatriot Corina Schroder, Nicole had made a real impact in the Bundesliga, firing 10 goals in 21 games for SC 07 from a wide position. She has also represented Germany at U19 and U20 level, where her side finished runners-up in the 2002 World Cup in Japan. Rolser signed a new deal in early 2015 to commit her future to Liverpool.

Fara has also played for Team GB as they reached the quarter-finals of the Olympics. Her honours list is impressive, winning the FA Cup, three league titles, FA Players’ player of the year and FA young player of the year awards.
